Navigation - Top

Top navigation is used to move between pages or sections of an application. When viewed on a mobile device, the navigation collapses each item into a list-style menu, accessible by touching the list icon in the top right corner of the header.

Examples

${require('html-loader?interpolate!../../partials/toggles.html')}

Basic Top Navigation with Dropdowns

  • Dropdown

User eXperience

Top Navigation with Widget

The Cart icon or Notification bell can be added to the right side of the top navigation component for projects that require them.  The Cart may appear without price information when its contents don’t have a price.

  • Link
  • Dropdown
    Action Another action

User eXperience

  • Link

  • Web Standards

User eXperience

Guidelines

  • Link names in the top navigation should be clear and concise, and should be limited to a number that can easily fit the horizontal space of the window.
  • Labels should be as descriptive as possible; avoid generic labels such as “Products” or “Services”.
  • Organize menu items by order of importance, starting with the most important. If there is a “Contact” screen, it should be last.
  • When only one set of navigation is required, top navigation is preferred over side navigation.
  • Due to the responsive behavior of this component, the top navigation code cannot be detached from the header.

Documentation

Bootstrap Documentation

Note that nested ul elements must be placed inside a parent li element.

Modifiers

Class Description
.cart-price add class to an a element within ul.uxf-nav-widgets > li to apply cart price styles
.cart-widget add class to an a element within ul.uxf-nav-widgets > li and add the necessary HTML as shown above to apply cart quantity styles
.notification-widget add class to an a element within ul.uxf-nav-widgets > li and add the necessary HTML as shown above to apply cart notification styles

Javascript

Top navigation uses Bootstrap's collapse plugin.

Convert from UXFrame v1 to v2 with .uxf-2018 Class

  1. Remove .clear-bottom-margin from div.nav-top
  2. Remove .home from the first li
  3. Remove li.search and its contents
  4. Change div .nav-top to div .navbar.navbar-default.navbar-static-top.uxf-top-nav
  5. Change div .wrapper-container to div .collapse.navbar-collapse#navbar-collapse
  6. Change li .selected to li .active
  7. Change li .has-sub-menu to li .dropdown
  8. Change ul .sub-menu to ul .dropdown-menu
  9. Add .nav.navbar-nav to the first div.collapse.navbar-collapse > ul
  10. Add .dropdown-toggle[data-toggle="dropdown "][role="button][aria- haspopup="true"][aria-expanded="false" ] to .dropdown > a
  11. Add .caret to .dropdown > a > span
  12. Add a .has-icon.icon-home surrounding a svg.uxf-icon-home inside the first li and add the necessary HTML inside svg.uxf-icon-home as shown above
  13. Add div.visibile-xs div.header-uxf-title h1 a after div.collapse.navbar-collapse and add the same page title in your header inside the a element
  14. Add li.clearfix.visible-sm.visible-xs button.navbar-back[data- toggle="collapse"][data-target="#navbar-collapse"][type="button"] before li > a.has-icon.icon-home and add the necessary HTML inside the button element as shown above
  15. Surround div.collapse.navbar-collapse with div.navbar__container.container
  16. Surround the content in each ul.nav.navbar-nav > li > a with span.link-text
Top Nav Price and Notification Options
  1. Change li.right-side to ul.uxf-nav-widgets
  2. Surround both div.price and div.cart with li elements
  3. Change div.price to a.cart-price
  4. Remove div.total
  5. Change div.currency to span
  6. Change div.cart to a.uxf-navbar-widget.cart-widget
  7. Change div .cart-icon to div .svg-icon and add the necessary HTML inside div.svg-icon as shown above
  8. Change div .cart-label to div .icon-text
  9. Change span .amnt to span .cart-count
  10. Change div.alert to a.uxf-navbar-widget.notification-widget
  11. Change div .alert-icon to div .svg-icon
  12. Change div .alert-count to div .notification-count
  13. Move div.notification-count inside div.svg-icon
  14. Add the necessary HTML before div.notification-count as shown before
